Instrument.name: Heliospheric Inst-Spectra, Composition, Anisotropy at Low Energy for ULY
Instrument.description: The Heliosphere Instrument for Spectra, Composition, and Anisotropy at Low Energies (HI-SCALE) is designed to measure interplanetary ions and electrons during the Ulysses mission. It employs five solid-state detector telescopes to achieve nearly complete pitch-angle coverage and can uniquely identify ions (Ei >50 keV) and electrons (Ee >30 keV). A delta E vs E telescope determines ion elemental abundances, and the instrument is controlled by a microprocessor data system. Calibration is facilitated by radioactive sources, and spectral information is collected using rate channels and a 32 channel pulse-height analyzer. The HI-SCALE instrument weighs 5.775 kg and requires 4.0 W of power, with initial measurements demonstrating its capabilities.
